News.Title: Regency Ceramics Q3FY26 Loss Widens to ₹516.26 Lakhs
News.Summary: Regency Ceramics reported a net loss of ₹516.26 lakhs for Q3FY26, wider than ₹383.41 lakhs in Q3FY25. Revenue surged to ₹1,152.23 lakhs from ₹396.08 lakhs year-on-year.

News.Title: Regency Ceramics Pledge Shares Invoked by APIDC
News.Summary: Regency Ceramics Limited disclosed that pledged equity shares held by promoters have been invoked by Andhra Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation, resulting in transfer to lender's account.

News.Title: Regency Ceramics Secures ₹6.66 Crore Order from GG Pro Build India Limited
News.Summary: Regency Ceramics Limited received a purchase order worth ₹6,65,97,079 from GG Pro Build India Limited for supply of floor tiles and associated materials with approximately 6 months delivery timeline. The domestic order involves technical specifications and quantities as stipulated by the client, with no promoter group interest in the contracting entity.

News.Title: Regency Ceramics Reports 601% Revenue Growth Despite Net Loss in Q1 FY2026
News.Summary: Regency Ceramics Limited reported revenue from operations of Rs. 672.04 lakhs for Q1 FY2026, representing a 601% increase from Rs. 95.86 lakhs in Q1 FY2025. Total income reached Rs. 855.18 lakhs compared to Rs. 128.65 lakhs in the previous year. Despite the revenue surge, the company posted a net loss of Rs. 196.01 lakhs, though this was an improvement from the Rs. 281.12 lakhs loss in Q1 FY2025. The ceramic tile manufacturer is rebuilding operations after a 2012 industrial incident that destroyed its factory. The company has entered an exclusive manufacturing arrangement for glazed vitrified tiles in Andhra Pradesh and is refurbishing its Yanam plant. Accumulated losses stand at Rs. 8,849.59 lakhs. The company received an income tax refund of Rs. 315.91 lakhs during the quarter and Rs. 15.14 crores from an insurance claim. The independent auditor issued a qualified conclusion highlighting concerns about unaccounted losses from the 2012 incident, non-provision of employee benefits, and lack of balance confirmations from debtors and creditors.
